metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3426 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
There's a flaw in Python 3's pydoc. A local or adjacent attacker whodiscovers or is able to convince another local or adjacent user to start apydoc server could access the server and use it to disclose sensitiveinformation belonging to the other user that they would not normally beable to access. The highest risk of this flaw is to data confidentiality.This flaw affects Python versions before 3.8.9, Python versions before3.9.3 and Python versions before 3.10.0a7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3426` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm12
libpython3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm12
libpython3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm12
libpython3.4-stdlib - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm12
libpython3.4-testsuite - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm12
python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm12
python3.4-examples - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm12
python3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm12
python3.4-venv - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm12
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python3.5 package in trusty/esm is affected and needs fixing.
python3.4 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm12').
